result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Bernard Otero

records.addlTxt:
1:28 PM Defendant Robert Bernard Otero appeared by zoom technolgy by video from the Benton County Jail with Attorney Roger M Hillestad appeared by phone.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. There has been an offer made and Mr. Otero wishes to waive his right to PH.  Court reviews right to PH with defendant.  Court finds Mr. Otero on advise of counsel KVI is waiving his statutory right to PH and we will proceed to arraignment.  Atty Hillestad requests a hearing for arraignment that may be a plea in December.
Arraignment scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
1:00 PM  Defendant Robert Bernard Otero appeared by zoom technology by video from Benton County jail without counsel.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. You previously appeared and was informed of your charges and rights.  Any questions?  No. Defendant informs he will be in MN bouncing around for a few cases and it will be a bit before back in the community and ask for a continuance to take care of things.  He has an attorney in MN and would need to obtain counsel in WI.  He will be looking into going into Team Challenge.  State requests to set matter out 30-60 days.  Mr. Otero informs his next hearing was set out 60 days.  Surety Bond remains in place.  The DA has the option to forfeit the surety bond if you do not appear.  Defendant continues to WTL for PH.  Court finds defendant WTL for PH.  Have a Fax #320-968-6347 for his paperwork to Benton Co. Jail.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert Bernard Otero

Prior: 3223 Minnehaha Avenue, Minneapolis, MN 55406
Adjourned initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:25 PM Attorney Jon Seifert appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Otero fails to appear.  Mr. Otero's employer signed as a surety.  Mr. Otero had other legal entanglements in MN.  State requests a warrant and authorized by the Court.  State moves to forfeit the bond.  State needs to file a motion to forfeit the bond and give notice to the surety.  Hearing scheduled.  Mr. Schroeder reports Mr. Otero was being transported to a jail in MN.  If someone can provide Mr. Seifert information of his whereabouts that would be helpful.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
$1000 cash bond or Mr. Otero's employer signing a surety bond of $1000.00.

1:25 PM Defendant Robert Bernard Otero appears by video from the Pepin County Jail.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed charges, penalties and rights. Mr. Otero has significant criminal history and outstanding warrants in State of MN, provided false information to law enforcement and not aware of any connections with Pepin Co. and ask $1000 cash bond.  Court inquires of Mr. Otero criminal history.  DA staff reads criminal history of defendant.   Off the record.  On the record.  Attorney Raymond argues bond and a surety willing to come forward to secure Mr. Otero.  State willing if the surety would post the difference and court finds surety faithful and appropriate.  Court finds Mr. Otero a flight risk and order $1000 cash bond and be posted in cash by Mr. Otero or his employer signing a surety bond of $1000.00.  If Mr. Otero does not appear, State would approach the surety to recover the $1000 bond.  Court advises defendant of a fugitive complaint being filed out of Benton County, State of MN for charge of Crime in the 3rd degree.  Mr. Raymond informs his client wishes to waive his right to governor's warrant.  Mr. Otero waives his right to extradition.  Court asks the jail provide Mr. Otero the waiver to sign and file with the Court.  Court reads the Order of Extradition upon Consent.  Once bond is posted, you will return to Benton Co., MN.  Defendant inquires if surety has to sign or pay?  He has to sign and will be responsible.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
